description: Frescobaldi helps with syntax, has help documents built in, and many thing I haven't had a chance to explore. There's a large community for Lilypond music notation (text based notation setting). Frescobaldi has been my go to for at least 10 years! (-_-)
summary: Great Music Notation Software for Lilypond Text Editing

description:
Used to be a great program and work fine. Since upgrade to python 3.10 it no longer runs keep getting the message :
Traceback (most recent call last):
 File "/usr/share/frescobaldi/frescobaldi_app/widgets/linenumberarea.py", line 83, in paintEvent
  rect.moveTop(geom.top())
TypeError: moveTop(self, int): argument 1 has unexpected type 'float'

Please fix!

Same problem here as Jim.

Now rendered useless.

This is -- rather was -- such a great music-editing environment I can hardly imagine going back to the old way -- edit your Lilypond file with a text editor, run it through Lilypond, go back to the text editor and fix your mistakes, lather, rinse, repeat ... BUT the version in the repository, 3.1.3, doesn't work with the latest version of Python. 
There is a new version, 3.2, but if you want to run it you have to install it yourself and there's a heap of arcane dependencies. Some of us can work through them. I may do it yet.
summary: Can we get the new version into the repository?

description: Python errors same as others have described here. Need new version in repos.

Hi

I downloaded 3.2 from frescobaldi website,but couldn't quickly work out how to install it, then downloaded from Ubuntu software.

I ended up with a fully working version 3.2 that's as excellent as I previously remembered it to be. I think it must be from the download from Ubuntu site but I'm not sure I'm brave enough to delete the download directly from the Frescobaldi website!
summary: Works fine - but 3.2 on my pc

description: I heard about Lilypond and wanted to give it a try. Certainly, I decided to download Frescobaldi as I found it was a great IDE for Lilypond. I've been a musician for many years but I never got very deep into reading and writing music. Using Frescobaldi and writing music with Lilypond is allowing me to become familiar with reading and writing music very quickly. I'm doing all this on my steam deck oled. I mainly want to use it to write long compositions to play on my synthesizers, instead of being limited to step sequencers. It connects with no issues to my synths via midi. I also got Qsynth which enables me to have midi files play audio on my deck if I simply want to hear quick samples of my work before setting it all up with my synths for the grand performance. Thanks for the great software, it's a great tool to have. Peace
musst mit Editor und Console arbeiten
summary: ist grad fehlerhaft leider in ubtuntu

description: Arbeite seit Jahren damit. Kann alles, was man braucht, selbst zum Setzen moderner Musik. Man braucht allerdings ein bisschen Geduld beim Suchen in der Dokumentation oder in Foren, um bei speziellen Fragen die richtigen Lösungen zu finden.

It requires at the very least knowledge about writing music. For single voice notes I managed to work pretty fast with a minimum of learning. But I had some programming experience on advanced beginner level in basic, dbase and java. Consulting the manual cannot be avoided :-)  .
Things may change to the more difficult with notes and words combined and multivoice notes.
Big advantage is to change keys and corresponding notes and other time saving features like changing the entire peace from C to F and the like.
summary: Given the complexities of writing music it is great

description: Beaucoup de petites fonctionnalités sympathiques dans tous les coins dont je ne pourrais plus me passer : pouvoir utiliser facilement plusieurs versions de LilyPond, que la version soit sélectionnée automatiquement à partir du \version, exécuter facilement convert-ly et voir les modifications avant d'appliquer, l'autocomplétion, la réindentation, le changement de langue pour les noms des notes, la conversion du relatif en absolu, …
